channel.title: She's On The Money on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics
channel.description: Recent content in She's On The Money on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: She's A Secret Hustler! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This Money Diarist will knock your socks off! She grew up sharing a bedroom with her mum and two siblings. She even bought her first property by 18 and kept it a secret from her mother. But now at the tender age of 21 she own 3 properties, is married and has just given birth to a beautiful baby girl. Hers is a story of intensely hard work, drive and thriving.

item.title: The Stingy Cringe | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Are you strutting towards the Christmas break or stumbling? If you're anything like us it's a mix of both! The full team are back on deck this week to deck the halls and celebrate your money wins, share some savvy broke tips, AND answer a Money Dilemma about how best to make your Superannuation work harder for you. Plus, things got hot this week as you slid into our D.

item.title: THE BUSINESS BIBLE: Creating Your Customer Avatar | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Have you ever heard of a customer avatar, customer persona, or something similar? It’s where we create a fictional person who becomes the outline of our ideal customer. They are the exact person that you will be selling to, marketing to, and talking to in your business or side hustle. Join Victoria and Jess for this special Business Bible episode of She's On The Money because in this episode, they'll help you figure out the name, age, gender, and a whole fictional character that aligns with your business!

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Loss, Lingering Grief & Legacy | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today's Money Diarist has endured huge loss. With the passing of both her nana and mum within a couple months of each other, she has come into some inheritance that allowed her to buy and apartment. She's had to restructure a lot about her life, future and finances and wants to share her complex story of grief and money. Send us your Money Diary Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: Bless This Christ- Mess | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It has been QUITE the week for the SOTM team! Join Bec and Jess for a hard earned Friday (get better soon Victoria!), as Jess shares your money wins, Bec brings some top notch broke tips. And this week we talk through the tricky situation of last minute wedding guest cancellations. Who should carry the cost when guests pull out one week before a destination wedding? There were feelings to be had!

item.title: Green Flags a Company Is a Good Investment | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We know how daunting it can be to start your investment journey, and aside from your personal values, what are some of the green flags we should be looking out for that tell us a company is a good investment? From P/B and P/E ratios to IPOs and more, Victoria Devine shares her top tips for figuring out if a company might be the right place for you to invest your hard earned dosh!

item.title: A Journey to Safety and Security | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This Money Diarist grew up with domestic abuser as a father, and lived in a refuge with her mum and brothers for 8 months. Not only was she the first in her family to ever go to university, but now she has a bachelors and a masters degree and works her dream job as a teacher! She completed her masters while having a baby and we cannot wait to share her with you!

item.title: Cost Of Living Keep Up | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Celebrate Friday SOTM style as the gals share your money wins, dish up some broke tips and answer a Money Dilemma about whether you can have your cake and eat it to when it comes to saving for a trip and still enjoying the finer things day to day! Plus, if you're not feeling the cost of living creep right now, you my friend are one of the lucky few!

item.title: A (very) Cost Effective Christmas! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know that Australians will spend a whopping $66.8 billion in the lead up to Christmas this year alone? On today's show we want to help you celebrate the season without breaking the bank! Join Victoria and Bec as they share some stats, tips and tricks for cheap, inexpensive, and sometimes free gift ideas to help you avoid going into debt this Christmas! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Turning Life Around After Parental Financial Abuse | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This weeks beautiful money diarist will definitely restore your faith in humanity. After being financially abused by her parents for the first half of her life, and clawing her way out of $23,000 in debt, she now owns a home, and is the shared carer of her 16-year-old sister. This weeks money diarist, truly has one of the biggest hearts, you'll be inspired after listening to this one.

item.title: Winners Are Grinners! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We didn't know at the time of recording, but She's On The Money won Best Business Podcast at the 2023 Australian Awards! Yes, that means we beat Mark Bouris! We're also celebrating money wins, and Bec has another left of field broke tip to share. Then, the girls offer advice about approaching the conversation with your partner, about them contributing to your super while you're off on maternity leave, and whether it's even a fair question when there's a large pay disparity.

item.title: BONUS EPISODE: How To Start Your Own Business With Jasmine Garnsworthy | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We have another bonus episode from our time in NYC! We're talking business with Jasmine Garnsworthy from Female Founder World. Jasmine is an Aussie living in New York, running her business which advocates, educates and highlights young women in entrepreneurship. In this chat with V, Jasmine gives you tips to start your business, and grow it once it's found its feet. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: THE BUSINESS BIBLE: Setting Up Your Small Business Books | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description ABNs, taxes, bank accounts, it's the very unsexy side of setting up a business, however do it right the first time, and your future self will thank you! V and Jess outline how to register business, which one is right for you, and how to make tax time easy! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: 'Rich' Isn't A Dirty Word | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week's amazing money diarist, grew up believing that 'rich people' were inherently bad, this was a belief that was passed down from her parents. After building her own seven figure business, she grappled with her identity and how her parents would accept her, now that she was one of those 'rich people.' We can't wait for you to hear this one, and be inspired by her story!

item.title: Home Sweet (Affordable) Home | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We are celebrating Friday, and yes, it's only November, but we are already getting excited for Christmas! Bec shares some broke tips, V has one of her own, and Jess has the community money wins! We've been INUNDATED with questions about housing and this week cover a question for first home buyers. Then, one of the juiciest DM's we have ever been sent which had the girls pretty unanimous on with their answers.

item.title: Deal or No Deal This Black Friday | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's that time of the year, where our email inbox gets flooded with promises of 'our biggest sale EVER!' Depending on how you approach this time of year, it could save you a lot of money, or potentially send you into debt. V and Bec chat the good and bad of Black Friday, and give you a foolproof plan to ensure you don't go broke this November! The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Sheep, Surrogacy, and The $200k Side Hustle | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week's amazing money diarist has overcome money anxiety he has held from his childhood after living on a farm through the drought. Now, he's building his dream life with his husband, working on the family farm, creating their own family farm, and accumulating up to $200k per year in side hustles! This money diarist proves that no matter what your relationship was with money, you can always change it to build a better life.

item.title: Get Rich (Quick Scheme) Or Die Tryin' | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday from V, Bec and Bin Raccoon (Jess' new nickname). We have some great money wins and broke tips to share with you, that you can implement in your own life... especially the return and earn. Then the girls weigh in on Tik Tok financial advisors, and whether their advice about buying a property with your super, is legitimate advice. Plus, a DM about a partner jumping from get-rich-quick-scheme to get-rich-quick-scheme, which is beginning to put a financial strain on their shared financial goals.

item.title: How To Get People To Take You Seriously With Tori Dunlap | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We are so excited to bring you a special episode from NYC! After receiving countless messages begging us to speak with Tori Dunlap from Her First 100k and the Financial Feminist, we managed to track her down! Tori is known for her no-nonsense authentic approach to helpign women, from all walks of life, become empowered to master their money and build a life that they love. She'll teach you how to advocate yourself to get your finances on track, and once that is sorted, most of everything else will fall into place.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Managing Money With ADHD & Anxiety | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week's gorgeous money diarist grew up feeling anxious about money. After her mum was in a financial pickle, she handed down some not so great money habits. Throw in ADHD and impulsive purchases, this money diarist has been working hard to change her money story, and she will teach you a superannuation hack which may change how your retire. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: Inexcusable Inheritance Issue | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description The girls are finally reunited and things get silly, before they get REALLY spicy. For the first time in weeks V, Jess, and Bec all unite, to share some amazing money wins from you, and Bec shares some (teetering on illegal) broke tips. Then, Jess takes the reigns to help with this week's Money Dilemma, as to how best make your house deposit work for you, if you're not ready to buy just yet.

item.title: Girl Math Your Way To Wealth | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Girl math, it's doing the rounds on social media, and sure it's seems like a bit of fun, justifying our purchases through a convoluted story, and math they wouldn't teach you at school... but is there something inherently sexist about it? V and Bec dig in to the topic of girl math, which will ensure you never use the phrase in the same way again. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Supporting a Partner Through A Health Emergency | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week's money diarist is a ray of sunshine and a savvy saver! After her partner suddenly experienced a health episode, the two lived off their savings, draining it almost completely, and are now clawing their way back to a bigger next egg. This diarist proves that even the biggest setbacks, shouldn't hold you back. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: The City That Never Sleeps... And Sends You Broke | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday! It's a special Friday ep today, with V and Jess joined by Brooke and Gabbie in the Big Apple! Yes, NYC was fun. Yes, V lived out some Wall Street dreams... but damn it's expensive! The girls chat about the best micro-investing platforms, and dive into a difficult DM about splitting finances in a relationship BEFORE you have children. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: How To Become Your Own Rich BFF With Vivian Tu | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We're so excited to bring you another episode from NYC, with the incredible Vivian Tu! You may known Vivian from Your Rich BFF, as the Wall St girly, or even from being featured in the 2023 Forbes 30 Under 30! Vivian shares her story from working at Wall Street, to Buzzfeed, to where she is now. She'll gives her tips on how to STRIIP (it's nothing dirty we promise), amd how you can become your own rich BFF!

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Home is where the cash is | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week's beautiful money diarist is warm, caring and savvy! She owned a house with her husband, and after a relationship breakdown and inflated interest rates, she turned her home that was costing her, into an Airbnb cash cow! However, this hasn't come without sacrifice. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: Debt Deception Dilemma | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description A very happy Friday from New Orleans! V and Jess have updates from their US travels, and even though can't be there in person she lives on with some cracker broke tips! Our money dilemma this week is when to cheat or break up with your mortgage broker in search of a better deal. Plus, a really juicy DM which gets the girls riled up about secrets, debt, and when this is a red flag in a relationship.

item.title: THE BUSINESS BIBLE: Finding The Why of Your Business | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description With more people now than ever embarking on side hustles and venturing into business, now is the time to bring back The Business Bible! Before you get started, Victoria Devine and Jessica Ricci, are getting you to answer some of the most crucial questions when it comes to starting your business, why are you starting it? Like really starting it? Is your idea any good? Can you make money off it?

item.title: The Business Bible is Back! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We are so excited to be bringing back the business bible! For all of our lovely community members who have been asking for my guidance setting up side hustles and businesses, Victoria Devine, owner of several successful businesses, and Jessica Ricci, one of the hardest working side hustlers, will help you every step of the way! See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information. Transcript

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: From Debt to Semi-Retirement | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week's money diarist has achieved so much in a few short years. After being close to $30,000 in debt, both her and her husband decided to do something about it. With a good plan, a better loan, and a lot of hard work, they are on their way to semi retirement next year! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: Let's Hear it For New York! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description She's on the Money are in New York! Keep your eyes and ears open for all the special US content coming your way! Trust us, you cant miss it. Our Money Dilemma this week is about job hopping, is it a turn off to other employers? Is it safe to do in the current job market? The girls have A LOT to say on this, and if you're looking for extra info, check out this episode.

item.title: Respecting Your Friend's Savings Goals | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description FOMO often leads us to spending more than we anticipated, and at times, more than we have in our bank accounts. Now is the time to ask yourself, are you surrounding yourself with people who are supporting your financial goals? Are you supporting your friends with theirs? We're diving into the startling stats of money spent around the wrong friends, and what a financially toxic friendship looks like.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Turning Life Around After Addiction | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week's beautiful money diarist has transformed her life in the past five years, after severe addiction and a life with money struggles, a surprising pregnancy was what turned her life around in an instant, and since that day has turned her money story and life, into something inspiring. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: Credit Where Credit's Due | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's a jam-packed Friday! Jess is back! V has a new book! And if you replicate some of this week's money wins and broke tips, you could be saving a small fortune! Our money dilemma this week lifts the lid on the potential scary world of the work credit card, don't freak out, V has your back! Plus, this weeks DM is a prickly one, which has us asking how nosey should you be into someone else's finances and relationship.

item.title: Ownership Structures of Investments Part B | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description As promised, part B is here! A few weeks ago we covered off Part A, which looked at setting up your own structures to personally own shares, now we're digging deeper into the different ownership structures of shares, ETF's, and managed funds. After this two-part series, you should be informed and confident enough to dive into investing, if you haven't already. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: BONUS EPISODE: Property with She's On The Money Book! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description SURPRISE! Today V launches ANOTHER book, 'Property with She's On The Money', and we're celebrating by sharing the very first chapter from the audiobook version with you! Whether you're trying to crack the property market for the first time, hunting for your dream home, or looking for an investment property, the book is packed with information to get you to your goal! You can find Property with She's on the Money at all good bookstores or online here: https://booktopia.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: The 24-Year-Old 6 Figure Earner | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today we're putting a spotlight on an amazing Money Diarist who has had a relentless work ethic since the day she could start working. This has led her toward cracking six figures at just 24 years of age AND buying her own home and renovating it! It doesn't stop there, today's Money Diarist has educated herself to make the most of her super and start investing in shares! This is one inspiring community member!

item.title: Re-Gifting... Rude or Right? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We've made it to Friday and with J-Ric still jet setting, V shares this week's Money Wins, and Bec helps you save a buck with her Broke Tips. Today's Money Dilemma is both a celebration and a contentious one, as one of our amazing community members is buying her first home (woo hoo!) but is contributing significantly more to the deposit than her partner... This week's DM gets V dishing out some of the BEST advice around re-gifting, which may have you rifling through your cupboards in preparation for Christmas.

item.title: Unpacking the Cost of an Overseas Sea Change | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description For many of us, we've all dreamt of packing up our lives and jet setting overseas to start a new life in a different country, but what is the reality of this fantasy? What are the true costs behind relocating overseas? What do we need to know before we go? And what happens to our debt left behind in Australia? Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: The Savvy Saver | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today's gorgeous community member and her partner purchased their home at 26 years old with no financial help from family or friends. Using some savvy savings, and wise investments, she is sure to encourage you on your own journey! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances. She's On The Money exists purely for educational purposes and should not be relied upon to make an investment or financial decision.

item.title: It's a V, B & A Friday! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description With Jess away, Victoria and Bec are joined by SOTM producer Annaliese for this free-wheeling Friday! As usual we celebrate your money wins, Bec brings the Broke Tips, and this week's Money Dilemma is all about managing your accounts. Plus this week you slid into our D.Ms about whether or not it's a red flag if a new partner has less savings than you. Does this mean you're not on the same page financially?

item.title: How Does Novated Leasing Work? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description What is a novated lease, how does it work, what should you consider, and what are some of the pros and cons of this arrangement? Today's episode is full of tips to help you make the best decision when considering whether novated leasing is right for you! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: Discovering Deception & Moving On! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today's inspirational Money Diarist has ridden quite the rollercoaster! After getting through 6 years of financial coercion in a relationship, she's managed to recover both a 65k car debt, and also a 40k personal loan. She has 2 kids with her new husband, but this relationship has recently broken down. She also left her full time salary to start her own business in Dec 2021. How does she manage it all?

item.title: From Babyccinos to Bill Splitting! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's pretty hard to top V's special news in today's episode, we are SO thrilled to hear that there will be a teeny new member of the SOTM family soon - CONGRATULATIONS Victoria and Steve!! And in Friday business as usual, we share your money wins and losses, dive into some Broke Tips and answer a tricky Money Dilemma about buying property with your partner (and their parents)! Plus, the good old bill split awks.

item.title: Ethical Landlords, Can They Exist? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We live in a world where rental housing has been increasingly converted into an investment asset. We’ve seen much debate in ours and the broader community that people shouldn’t own an investment property till everyone has a house. So today we’re talking about ethical landlords – what does this mean, is it possible? What are our Australian values around renting and more globally what the landscape? Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: A Journey to Abundance | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This gorgeous Money Diarist immigrated from Ukraine when she was 6 years old with nothing. At 19 she met her soon to be husband, and by 22 they were married and had bought their first home intertwined with family. They now have 2 kids and last week cut up all of their credit cards! We can't wait for you to meet this inspiring member of the SOTM community.

item.title: Spending Is My Love Language | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's Fri-yay! Celebrate with the team back together this week as J-Ric shares your money wins and losses, B-Sy brings the best Broke Tips, and V-Dev sheds light on how the Medicare safety net threshold works in this week's Money Dilemma. Plus, what is your love language in a relationship? What do you do when your other half likes to spend up big, but you prefer a more budget conscious approach?

item.title: Ownership Structures of Investments Part A | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Before you purchase an asset it’s important to consider the most appropriate investment structure to use, because getting it right at the beginning can have significant long term benefits, and getting it wrong can be expensive to sort out! So today we explain ownership structures of investments. We look at how to choose the kind of structure for your needs, breakdown what they are, and SO much more.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: The Pressure To Be Perfect | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today's Money Diarist recently a quit toxic (but well paying) tech job to run a small business with her dad. As an immigrant, she has always felt family and societal pressure to achieve and wonders if she should have stuck with the more "traditional" career path. Hers is a totally relatable story of consolidating pressure, and finding her truth! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: The Sublet Slap In The Face | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday angels, today JRic is sick (get better soon!) but V and Bec bring all the Friday fun. As usual they share your money wins and losses, Bec brings the Broke Tips, and today's Money Dilemma is from a new mumma wondering about whether to take a leap of faith into a new work venture for better work/life balance. Plus, today's D.M got the gals pretty riled up.

item.title: Job Hopping to Increase Your Income | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description The rise of job hopping is changing the landscape of employment, with companies needing to adapt their retention strategies to keep employees engaged. And while loyalty and engagement with your workplace is important, often the most effective way to get the salary increase you want is by changing jobs. So today we unpack this concept and look at some of the pros and cons! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Setting Boundaries & Standing On Her Own 2 Feet | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Get ready to be inspired by this amazing Money Diarist! She's a 27 year old, full time agricultural student who is working in the industry, and coming to terms with being estranged from her family. Out of school she went to uni, but when trauma began to surface, she had to take a break to prioritise her mental health. Despite her incredible strength in honoring and caring for her trauma, and moving though it, she's battling with perpetually feeling like she's at square one with her finances, unable to save or invest.

item.title: Scamming the Scammer! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today is a VERY fine Friday indeed, not only did we just get announced as finalists in this year's ACRA awards (for Best Podcast and Best Producer!!!), but just wait till you get the low down on how the girlies got their own back on the scammer who duped JRic's Instagram account! Plus we share your money wins, Bec is back with her broke tips AND we answer a Money Dilemma all about what to do with your juicy tax return.

item.title: Under the (F)influence | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description With the rise of the "Finfluencer" and in this age of information overload, it is incredibly overwhelming to know who you can you trust. On this extra special episode Victoria and Jess are joined by Vince Scully from Life Sherpa and Queenie from Invest With Queenie for a fireside conversation all about the current landscape of financial (mis)information, how to avoid getting your information from the wrong source, and OH so much more!

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: The Financial Side of Fertility | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Todays gorgeous Money Diarist is a 29 year old Law student, and full time employee in litigation. She's also a part time step mum dealing with infertility, and juggling her finances while doing it all! Having spent 10k on 3 rounds of IVF with her partner, she wants to share her experience of navigating the fertility journey, and the impact that these procedures can have on your finances and your relationships.

item.title: Polyamory & Equity | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday! With Bec away today V and Jess will play...and bring you all the SOTM community content we LOVE to celebrate to round off the week. Jess brings (our ever favorite segment) community money wins from the Facebook group. Plus this week, V shares a Money Dilemma which asks what to do when you discover that people doing the same job as you (who started after you) are getting paid more!

item.title: Changing Your Financial Decisions | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description When the Victorian Premier recently cancelled the 2026 Commonwealth Games due to it going way over budget, it raised a lot of feelings from the public! But for SOTM this raises an even more important point. Why should it ever not be ok to change your financial decisions if they are going to have a negative impact on your life? On today's show we dissect why we often stick with a bad plan, how to shift our mindset, and how to look out for future you!

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: The Art Of Calculated Risk-taking | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description What's your tolerance for risk? Well, this Money Diarist bought a $1.5m home (sight unseen) in her dream suburb with her partner, then rented it because they couldn’t yet afford to live in it. Like the rest of us, with their repayments increasing, her partner also just took a $50k pay cut. But in spite of this, they are about to move in, and she wants to share her story of calculated risk taking with the community!

item.title: Finance or Fur-baby First? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Join us for our FAVOURITE day of the week as we get to celebrate you, our gorgeous community! As ever, Jess shares your money wins and losses, Bec brings some top broke tips, and Victoria gives some red hot advice for managing finances as freelancer in this week’s Money Dilemma! And this week’s D.M gets a little emotional as we talk about the cost of affording a pet.

item.title: Constructing Your Perfect Investment Portfolio | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description With so many of you well on your way with your investment journey, on today's episode Victoria is running us though her top things to consider when constructing your perfect investment portfolio! Particularly the multifaceted nature of risk, and how to understand it when it comes to your portfolio. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: How to Recover After a Financial Mess | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's inevitable in life that we will face many stresses, and financial problems are amongst the most common causes of stress and relationship breakdowns. Yet when we are in the depths of it, there can be tremendous shame, loneliness and a sense that there is no way out. So on the show today we discuss how to recover after a financial mess. We'll take a look at resetting your mindset, and some practical tips for turning things around.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: The MUST listen to Single Mum of 2! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This Marine Scientist, Gen X, single mother of two teens is a MUST listen to! She has come from zero financial literacy and navigated divorce, and her journey of growth and education is utterly inspiring. She joins Victoria to reflect on previously living paycheck to paycheck (in spite of her high earnings) and her transformation into a budgeting QUEEN! She's also teaching her teens to invest in their own Superannuation.

item.title: Love Runs Hot...Or Cold! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Celebrate Friday SOTM style as Jess shares your money wins and losses, Bec brings some top broke tips and VD discusses a Money Dilemma about buying in bulk. Plus, do you and your partner run at a different temp? Does this cause conflict when those utility bills roll in? Well, you're not alone! The gals unpack this common couple conflict! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Letting Go Of Your Ego | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Having growing up in a money savvy household and having studied commerce, today's Money Diarist thought she had a good grip on her finances. But when she was left with nothing in her bank account after a bad relationship ended, she had some reckoning to do. Still struggling after a year of living alone, she decided to move back in with her parents. She wants to share her story of the strength that comes after letting go of the ego, and starting again.

item.title: She Wanted Vanilla... | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday! It's a Bec-less ep today but never fear, Victoria and Jess have PLENTY for you today. As ever we share your money wins, solve a Money Dilemma about salary packaging, AND a tricky DM was dealt to us this week. If your partner gets a financially rewarding, but remote work opportunity, should you pack up your thriving small business to follow them? Tune in to get the goss!

item.title: Sneaky Ways Credit Card Companies Keep You In Debt | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Sadly but not surprisingly it is in the interest of credit card companies to keep you in a cycle of debt. And on top of social and life pressures that push us towards spiralling consumer debt, the companies themselves have mastered the art of manipulation to trap you. So today on the show we are breaking down the sneaky ways credit card companies keep you in debt and then we’re going to tell you what you can do to break out of the cycle!

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Cutting Ties and Thriving! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today's Money Diarist is the epitome of grace, endurance and quiet personal power. She's nearly 50 and has recently separated from her husband. They were never on the same page when it came to money, which added to the stresses of owning a business together. She took care of HR and accounts working out the budget, which he would then totally overspend on. She wants to share her story of surviving a 10 year marriage, how she got out of a bad situation, and started to thrive again!

item.title: Single Is Spenno! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Here we are at Friday again which can mean only one thing, its time to unwind with us as we celebrate you! Jess wraps your money wins and losses, Bec shares some tips on the tighter side, AND V delivers sage advice on a Money Dilemma from a FREELANCE ACROBAT (!!) asking all about the smartest way to funnel limited savings. Plus, this week's D.M is another doozy on sharehouse equity.

item.title: Cost Of Living-Core | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description There is no doubt that cost of living is weighing heavily on all of us. No matter who you are, we're all feeling the pinch of the soaring cost of groceries, utilities and interest rates! So, on today's episode we embrace the season we're currently in, and give you tips and tricks to not only make your dollar go further but have fun along the way! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: The Spending & Saving Swing | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today's Money Diarist has already been on a huge financial journey at the tender age of 25. When she was 6, her parents suddenly separated due to a secret affair. Her spending and saving habits go through extreme swings and a misdiagnosis of anxiety/depression cost her dearly both mentally and financially. But a recent diagnosis of ADHD has helped her turn a corner, and she's just paid off $25,000 of consumer debt!

item.title: To Sublet, or Not To Sublet? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's Fri-yay angels, and to get you in the mood join V, J and B to wrap the week right. Jess shares your Money Wins, Bec brings the Broke Tips and we answer a Money Dilemma about calculating your Super for retirement. Plus, we get a SPICY community D.M about subletting in a share house. Listen in to see who's side you're on! Links Want to try Marley Spoon?

item.title: Sort Your Career Out Q&A! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description On today's super charged episode Victoria Devine and Jessica Ricci are joined by our friends from My Millennial Money and the Sort Your Career Out book team, Glen James and Shelly Johnson for a community Q & A! They give you all of the top tips, and one hell of a pep talk to get you mindful and motivated about your career! Links Boldside online and on Instagram

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Starting All Over Again...& Again! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Having travelled a lot in her 20s, this Money Diarist moved overseas and into a bad relationship right before covid hit! She lost her job and took out her super to get out of the situation, and had to start again, and then again! She made her way back home, and into a new career (and love). One year later, and she's just settled on her new home with her partner and wants to share her stop and start story with the community.

item.title: She Want Prenup?! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's Friday again and time to join Victoria, Jess and Bec as they celebrate your money wins and losses, Bec shares some broke tips, plus they answer a Money Dilemma about the difference between being on a casual and part time contract. Plus this week you slid into our D.Ms about prenups...otherwise known as Binding Financial Agreements in Australia. How do you have this conversation with your partner? Listen in to find out.

item.title: An Investor's Guide to Tax Time | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Welcome to the new financial year friends, and today we bring you an investor’s guide to tax time. We step though a few important points on this HUGE topic to give you some general basics, the tax implications and possible benefits of certain investments, plus so much more! Useful links... Money Smart Income Tax Calculator Money Smart Investing & Tax ATO Tax Time Tool Kit For Investors ATO Rental Property Guide Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: A Lesson in 4 Legged Investments! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This gorgeous and hardworking community member first listened to SOTM while working the farm on a tractor. She's a 3rd generation farmer who at 24 years old is studying to be a Veterinarian, saving to be able to afford to do her rotations and has a thing or two to teach us about diversified investments, of the 4 legged kind! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: It's Tay-Tay Friday | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description What rhymes with Friday? That's right, and you can expect a pretty T-Swizzle heavy show today cause the gals got tickets! Plus in regular programming, we share your money wins and losses, Bec gives you some broke tips and we answer a Money Dilemma about working from home expenses at tax time. Plus, this week you slid into our D.Ms about traveling with your besties. What happens when you're on a trip of a lifetime, but you and your friends have different budgets?

item.title: Negotiating Workplace Benefits | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today we talking about another tricky workplace topic that can be a big source of anxiety, but in the current economic climate is more important than ever! How to negotiate workplace benefits. If you've been on the end of a hard 'no' when it comes to pay rise, there are lots of other things you can ask for. So today we’re going to talk about how to prep for a negotiation at work, how to have that conversation, some of the mandatory things you should be getting in a workplace in Australia, and some of the optional extras that people ask for!

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Life Beyond Spending Guilt | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This first time mum with a tiny tot works full time in the events industry plus has a side hustle as a celebrant, and we ALL know how much V loves a good wedding chat! This diarist has overcome huge spending guilt, inherited from her parents' complex relationship with money. But has changed the landscape in her own marriage and she and her husband are totally on the same page when it comes to money.

item.title: The Party Clean Up Cough Up? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Join us for another fab Friday hang out where we celebrate your money wins and Bec shares her top broke tips! PLUS we answer a Money Dilemma all about reframing your skills and mindset to earn some extra cash. Plus, if you have a party and your guests make a mess, should everyone split cleaning costs? You slid into our D.Ms about this and there were feelings! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: Nailing A Job Interview | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Job interviews can be nerve-wracking, but with the right approach and a dash of confidence, you can absolutely nail it. We all have unique qualities that can shine in an interview setting, it’s just about getting into the mindset and doing the prep so that you truly sparkle! Today we give you a step by step guide to nailing that job interview. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Working Hard & Acknowledging Privilege! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This community member is the youngest of 5, in a family where they weren't taught about money. Then her mum and dad began to struggle financially and started to borrow money from their grown kids. At 25 her career in financing in the automotive industry saw her earning 130k a year and she purchased her first home while single. Now at 31, she's engaged and buying another house while paying for a wedding.

item.title: My OnlyFans, My Business? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description With V back on deck today, all is right in the SOTM-sphere! So we celebrate Friday with your Money Wins, Bec shares some brilliant Broke Tips, plus we answer a Money Dilemma all about tricky investing terms. Plus, we have been hearing a lot of stories lately about employer conflict with side hustles. So it's unsurprising that you slid into our DMs with a VERY spicy one. This community member is conflicted about disclosing her OnlyFans side hustle to her employer.

item.title: Getting Ready For Tax Time | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description EOFY is our favorite time of year, but it can be intimidating if you don’t feel on top of your income tax. Don't worry, we have you covered! Today we look at some changes to tax that you should be aware of, things the ATO are cracking down on this year, plus we give you some tips to help this time of year run a little easier. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Geophysicist at the Top of Her Game | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This 32 year old, mother of 2 is a geophysicist in the energy industry making $152k only working four days a week. She followed in her father’s career footsteps, but not before going though her own cycle of consumer debt. She is passionate about pay transparency and wants to shed some light on the earning potential in industries many people don’t know about! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: The 1st Ever B & J Q & A! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday fam! With V away (get well soon V), its time for the first ever B & J Q & A! You sent in some questions for Bec and Jess and they get to them, with a little cameo from our producer Annaliese too! Plus, we share your money wins and losses and Bec's Broke Tips! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: Quarterly Market Update | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description On today's episode we discuss what’s happening in the economy right now, and what this mean for all of us. From interest rates and investments, to inflation and indexation plus so much more. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances. She's On The Money exists purely for educational purposes and should not be relied upon to make an investment or financial decision.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Well On Her Way to 100k! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Try and catch your breath as you listen to this story! This Money Diarist is 21and is working 3 jobs with the goal of saving $100,000 in two years. She's one year in and on track but is working 70- 80 hours per week across multiple jobs. Growing up she watched her mum endure several abusive relationships and this is driving her determination to never be financially dependent on anyone.

item.title: Salary or Sanity? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Ring in Friday just right with Victoria, Jess and Bec as they share your money wins and Bec brings her broke tips (feat shiny new theme song)! Plus we answer a Money Dilemma about how to get the ball rolling on starting to save. And this week you slid into our D.Ms to ask whether you should prioritse a good work culture over an amazing salary. There are SO many angles to this so don't miss the discussion!

item.title: The Myth of Making It Financially | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Why are we striving to “make it” financially? Is it because we think we won’t be stressed, and that we will be happier? Is it even possible to ever "make it"?Today, we look at some of the mental traps, pressures and toxic cultural narratives that drive this myth and how we can strive for our goals and keep it real! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: A Total Game Changer! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Wait till you meet this game changing member of our community! She's a 29 year old Torres Straight Islander woman with 2 kids. At 23 years old, her ex left her at 8 months pregnant to pay their mortgage. But she is now in the final year of her Doctor of Medicine, she's tutoring, plus managing a side hustle all while saving for her wedding with FIFO fiancée!

item.title: The Split Up Rent Split | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Your Friday is about to get a whole lot better as the gals celebrate your money wins (and losses)! Bec brings her new segment "Broke Tips" (DM her your tips on insta @becsyed). Plus we solve a Money Dilemma about how to manage cashflow across accounts. AND you slid into our DMs this week about how to split rent in a share house when a couple breaks up. We have ALL been there!

item.title: Is Math Anxiety Making You Bad At Money? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Are you scared of math? Are numbers just not your thing? Well this does not mean you're automatically bad at money! If left unaddressed, math anxiety can end up shaping decisions you make further down the track and you might bury you head in the sand when it comes to your money. On today's episode we unpack math anxiety, how it plays out and what you can do about it.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: A Humble & Huge Heart | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Wait till you meet this incredibly strong and humble member of our community! She and her brothers were raised by their single mum who experienced bankruptcy after leaving a violent relationship with their dad who was also a gambling addict. Having dealt with her own mental health and health struggles, she is now a rock for others and working in child protection after 9 years at uni, finally earning a full-time salary!

item.title: Egg Freezing Economics | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's Friday again fam, so we celebrate your money wins, answer a Money Dilemma about the best way to pay for getting your eggs frozen, AND should a couple split wedding costs equally? Well you slid into our D.Ms this week about this very topic and there are MANY feeling about this one! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: The Cost Of Cancer | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s episode is the 3rd in a series of conversations we’re having that look at the true costs of healthcare in Australia. Cancer is high on the list of most common diseases that Australians face, so today we breakdown the prevalence, average lifetime cost of different types of Cancer, cost to carers and so much more. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: The Art of Turning Your Mindset Around | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description 3 years ago she had no savings and refused to talk about money. She was also studying a health degree that she had zero passion for. Fast forward and she has followed her dreams of becoming a full time artist (and has staff), she's debt free, has tax savings, and has completely turned her money mindset around. How did she do this? Listen in to find out! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: Pay-rise Schmay-rise! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday! Help celebrate our favorite day of the week as we share your money wins and losses, answer a Money Dilemma about declaring your salary expectations in a job application, AND you slid into our DMs this week about pay rises. They're always exciting right? Well what if they don't match the success of your company, or even inflation? The girls have feelings on this one, and you did too!

item.title: Indexation & HECS/HELP Debt | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description HECS or HELP debt has long been described as “the best debt you can have” BUT is this still the case? With indexation on HECS/HELP set to increase on June 1st to 7.1%, what does this mean for people with this debt? Today we are getting the downlow on HECS/HELP debt and indexation, what debt we should prioritise paying off and so much more! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Riding the Redundancy Rollercoaster...& Ruling! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week's Money Diarist has a fascinating story full of financial flexibility and following her heart. Having grown up in the UK, her dad got injured and couldn’t work, so mum carried two jobs to support the family. Fast forward and she has ridden a redundancy rollercoaster, gotten engaged and then married after three months, owns a house/Airbnb AND is saving for another investment property, and this is only the tip of the iceberg!

item.title: Mo-Money, Mo-Manchild? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Join us to celebrate Friday with as we share your money wins and losses, answer a juicy Money Dilemma all about travel insurance and credit cards. PLUS, does your other half share the same financial goals as you? If not, is that reason to call it quits? Hear what the gals, AND our community have to say about it! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: Investing In A High Inflation Market | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description There is no doubt that we are in a stressful economic situation right now, but every season brings a different opportunity! So today we are going to give you tips and tricks on how to invest in a high inflation environment. We look at why inflation currently sits where it is, the sorts of investments that are more viable in this landscape and do a bit of an investment mindset check in.

item.title: The Property Playbook is Back! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Guess what? The Property Playbook is back today! Buying your first home or investment property is hard but The Property Playbook is here to help. Join Millennial money expert and She's On The Money host Victoria Devine, along with aspiring homeowner Jessica Ricci for valuable insights and practical tips, so you can be fully prepared for today's housing market. You'll also hear inspirational Property Diaries from people in the She's On The Money community, helping you through every step on your journey to home ownership.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: A Decade in Debt to Dream Job | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Forget everything you thought you knew, cause this Money Diarist is here to remind you that you write your own script! Growing up with a single mum with 9 credit cards, debt was normalised. She left home at 16 with nothing but the clothes on her back and lived off Centrelink and then found herself in a world of credit cards and personal loans. After spending the last decade in debt, in two years of listening to SOTM, she's been able to double her income, wipe the debt, get an emergency fund and is saving for her first home and financial freedom!

item.title: The Equity Irk | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description As we roll into Friday, join Victoria, Jess and Bec as we celebrate your money wins, share the losses, and we answer a tough Money Dilemma about unexpected funeral costs. Plus, should you pay less for household expenses if you're on a way lower salary that your housemates? Should equity exist in friendships? You slid into our D.Ms this week to ask just that, and boy does it get SPICY!

item.title: The True Cost Of Mental Healthcare | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Aussies are among the most under insured people in the world, our “she’ll be right” mentality puts us at risk of being in dire straights when unexpected things happen with our health. 45.5% of the Australian population experience a mental health condition at some point in their lifetime. This means it shares the stage with cancer and heart disease the most common of medical life disrupters. Today we take a truthful look at the cost of mental health care so you’re not caught out, and shut out of the care you deserve!

item.title: MONEY DIARY: Unpaid Nursing Placement & Hustling Hard! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Need a little pick me up? Wait to you meet this Money Diarist! She's only 20 and between full time uni, placements, travel and a busy life, she's managed to hit $100k in savings. She's currently in an unpaid nursing placement in remote Australia, and has really made the most of her dollars, time and family backing to educate herself and work hard towards her goals whist acknowledging the privilege she came from.

item.title: Broke for Brunch, But Not Designer Bags? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's Friday friends, so join us as we celebrate your money wins, answer a Money Dilemma that EVERYONE is worried about at the moment - indexation and HECS! Plus this week YOU slid into our DMs about that friend who is always too broke from brunch with the gals, but is always kitted out with new outfits or bags. Well, we have feelings on this and can't wait to share!

item.title: The Cost Of Contraception | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description One in two women will experience an unplanned pregnancy in their lifetime. More than half of these women were using at least one form of contraception at the time. Currently, Australia has a Senate Enquiry into Reproductive Healthcare which is highlighting the problems with access and cost options for women across the country. So we thought we'd have a bigger conversation on the show about the cost and accessibility of different types of contraception, the Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme and so much more.

item.title: MONEY DIARY: From Death & Debt to Dream Home | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This Money Diarist has navigated the death of her ex-husband and one of his children, being the executor to his estate, all while raising a young family and continuing her career. She is now managing the family budget, moving into her ‘forever home’ with her FIFO hubby and reconciling with the past. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: FINE Friends? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Celebrate Friday SOTM style with Victoria, Jess and Bec as we celebrate your money wins and answer a Money Dilemma about travel emergency funds. And this week you slid into our D.Ms with a topic that split our own team! Who should chip in if you're driving your mates and you get a parking fine? Think the answer is clear cut? THINK AGAIN! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: The Cost Of Care | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Australians are some of the most underinsured people on the planet, there’s a reason that “she’ll be right” is a national saying! But you can never know what is around the corner with your health. Which is why today we’re talking about the cost of care with a very special guest Rhiannon Tracey who is a speaker, wellness advocate and the Founder & Executive Director at The Next Step SCI Recovery & Wellness Centre.

item.title: MONEY DIARY: A Force To Be Reckoned With | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This young Money Diarist has been through it all. Growing up, her dad got her family into debt. After her brother passed away, her father left and all of a sudden her Mum had to juggle work, study and raising a young family alone. Mum provided a model of stepping up to do whatever it takes! Due to an assault she was unable to finish year 12, and she recently left an abusive relationship that was also financially abusive.

item.title: Are You A Smoother Or A Scruncher? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's a very good Friday indeed so join the gals to celebrate your Money Wins (and losses), and answer a Money Dilemma about the best way to keep track of your records for tax time. Plus in Easter news - we ask the BIG question, are you a smoother OR a scruncher? And, this week you slid into our DMs about group gifts. How do you and your friends manage gifting?

item.title: Investing On A Low Income | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Ever thought that investing is for the rich? It's a super common misconception. Well this episode is for you! Join Victoria and Bec as they discuss tips for investing on a low income; how can you get started, what kind of impact can it have on future wealth and so much more! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARY: Health Crisis, Homelessness & Now Happier Than Ever | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This inspirational Money Diarist went from being financially stable, to jobless and homeless with a young family, after her husband was fired due to being deaf. They navigated $30k for medical treatment in the US for their son, and relocating to the other side of Australia. Their journey has been one of so much growth, and she's now running a thriving solo business. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: You Gotta Pay to Play! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's Friday friends so join the gals as they share your money wins and losses and answer a Money Dilemma about HECS repayments. And this week, you slid into our DMs about who should pay when a friend pulls out of a group trip and it pushes the cost up for everyone else. We've ALL been there, so listen in to see what the gals have to say on this one!

item.title: How Tax Works | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Strap yourself in, because on today's episode we talk all about tax! Why do we pay tax? What are the tax brackets and how do they work? What kind of income is taxable and so much more. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances. She's On The Money exists purely for educational purposes and should not be relied upon to make an investment or financial decision.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: From Partying to Proud Chihuahua Mumma | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This unstoppable Money Diarist has gone from living off Centrelink and being addicted to drugs and partying, to studying Psychology and earning close to 90k per year. Her life is finally changing for the better in every way. She now works in foster care, is the proud mama to a Chihuahua and wants to inspire others who are struggling. Content warning - this episode contains conversations about substance abuse, suicidal ideation and mental health struggles.

item.title: The Side Hustle Buddy Boundary | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's our favorite time of the week again cause we get to celebrate YOU! As per usual we share your money wins and losses, and answer a Money Dilemma about home loan repayment periods. PLUS, last week we talked about supporting a friend's side hustle. Well this week, you slid into our DMs about having the side hustle and setting boundaries with your buddies. Do NOT miss some very helpful tips on avoiding awkward situations with your besties.

item.title: The Bank Of Mum & Dad | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description "The Bank Of Mum & Dad" is a term we have been hearing about a lot more lately! But what does it mean and why is it on everyone’s lips at the moment? On today's episode we discuss BOMAD, its origins, impact on the economy and so much more. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Scammed By Her Own Fam! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This incredible Money Diarist is a doctor who got scammed $271k by her cousin who lived overseas! She has finally managed to get out of a financial hell hole with a lot of help and hard labor and it has catapulted her financial literacy like nothing else! She hopes that by sharing her experience it will help raise awareness of how these things can happen, and also break down the stigma for others who have also been scammed.

item.title: The Feedback Sandwich | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It sure doesn’t feel like a Friday on SOTM unless we kick back and celebrate with you! Today the gals talk their recent IWD whip round the country and we hear from some of you who made it to our Melbourne event! We also celebrate your money wins and answer a Money Dilemma about how to improve your credit score. Plus, does a friend of yours have a side hustle that you feel pressured to support?

item.title: Removing the Guilt of Not Giving | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Very often in life you can’t make your money go far enough to do all the things that you “want” or even “should” do. Giving to charity can be one of these things that we know is super important, which is why we often carry guilt when we can't afford to. So today we talk about the mindset of giving, managing the guilt around not being able to afford it, other ways that you can give that might not impact your budget and so much more!

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Loving the Inner Child | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description She grew up with polar opposite immigrant parents; tiger parent vs carefree. She found herself earning minimum wage in a toxic work environment, to tripling her income in an amazing job and team. With a profitable side hustle on the go, her most important work to date has been repairing the relationship with her inner child and having the best circle of friends that love and support me unconditionally.

item.title: Friend or (Fin) Foe? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's Friday again and celebrate with us as we share your money wins and talk the losses, answer a money dilemma about budgeting to be paid monthly. PLUS you sild into our DMs about friends who undermine your financial goals, has this ever happened to you? Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: Ethical & Sustainable Fashion | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today we're looking at ethical and sustainable fashion vs fast fashion. We'd all prefer to be ethical and sustainable in our choices, but there is often an added cost to these items that many simply can’t budget for. Listen in as the gals break it down and talk facts, figures, privilege, priorities and so much more! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: A Breath of Fresh Air | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today's Money Diarist grew up with a single dad who worked long hours and was always burdened by debt. She navigated a 30k loan at 21, and now at 28 years old, she has bought a home, a new car, is planning her wedding, and building her wealth and finances up with her fiancé. All while processing her next career steps. She's sure to inspire you! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: Life on a Pension | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Hey hey its Friday again so join us as we celebrate your money wins and answer a money dilemma about spending your savings, or taking out a loan to set up your small business. Plus, this week you slid into or DMs about the difficulty of living on a pension, listen back as the girls talk all about it. The gals are on the road right now and you can get your tickets to our upcoming IWD tour here.

item.title: Back to Basics Of Investing | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Know nothing about investing? Well this is the episode for you! Victoria takes us back to the basics explaining what a share is, the different types of shares, how you earn money from shares how compound interest works and more. Plus we unpack some common concerns around investing, and some questions we should be asking ourselves at the start of our journey to determine our next steps! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Jail, Debt & Learning to be Free | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This fascinating Money Diarist grew up in a family with a lot of money, only to loose it all when her dad went to prison. Having then gotten into a huge sum of personal debt, she is now 100% financially independent, has travelled the world, payed for her dream wedding and honeymoon. You'll be inspired by her story! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: Coughing Up For Contraception! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday! Join the gals to celebrate your money wins and answer a juicy money dilemma about setting money aside for a child. Plus, who should pay for contraception? You slid into our DMs this week asking this very question and the gals got thoughts! Get your tickets to our upcoming IWD tour here. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: Why Are Women Overworked & Underpaid? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Australia's Gender Pay Gap is currently 22.8% and is increasing and we are absolutely outraged! So today we are talk about why women are overworked and underpaid. We look at the math, the stereotypes, the quiet and overt forces in society that contribute to this situation and what we can do about it! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Hope After Homelessness | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week's Money Diarist has overcome so much! Having found herself homeless at 17 years old, she was diagnosed with Bipolar Disorder, PTSD and IBS. It was then that her life started to turn a corner for the better, after receiving NDIS support. She's now working on a budget with her Occupational Therapist, has savings, and even has an emergency fund for her cats! She's extraordinary and we can't wait for you to meet her.

item.title: Falling Back on the Bank of Mum & Dad? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's Friday so that means it's time to kick back with Victoria, Jess and Bec and share your money wins and losses! They also answer a money dilemma about buying property, AND this week you slid into our DMs about the bank of mum and dad! Is it ok to be jealous of your friend who can fall back on their parents pocket? Or is comparison the theif of joy?

item.title: Mortgages & the Home Buying Process | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description In the current economic climate so many of us feel like buying a home is totally out of reach, but is it really? Well to answer this, we've brought in Zella Finance Director and award winning Finance Broker Cait Bransgrove to talk about the home buying process, mortgages and cover what you need to know coming into 2023! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: From Getting Drained to Absolutely Dominating! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Wait till you hear this one! This week's gorgeous Money Diarist came to the realisation after 7 years of marriage that her husband was more like a dependent, than a partner. She had supported his study, paid for their living expenses and even their home. But with two very young girls, she was worried that she wouldn't manage to make ends meet if she left him. Well, she did and now she is dominating her finances, has savings for her daughters future and is absolutely thriving!

item.title: Share House, Shared Costs? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Hey hey it's Friday friends, and boy are we ready for it! Join Victoria, Jess and Bec as they unwind by celebrating ALL things community! They share your money wins and losses, and answer a money dilemma about whether you are ever too old to work towards your financial freedom. Plus if you've ever lived in a share house, then you will know the ALL too common pain of that 'stingy' homie who always wiggles their way out of buying toilet paper.

item.title: What is Bargain Regret? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Have you ever gotten carried away in a sale and bought way more than you budgeted for? Bargain regret is a very real and common experience! On today's show we take a look at the psychology of selling, and the things that push you to overlook your budget and buying intentions in the name of a bargain, and what you can do about it! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Finally On the Right Meds & the Right Track | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week's Money Diarist has endured financial abuse, losing her partner to suicide, and years of trying to manage her bipolar disorder without the right treatment. But she finally found the right meds and it has literally turned her life around! She is now able to work and study, get her financial life on track all while raising her two girls! She is incredibly special and we can't wait for you to meet her.

item.title: Split Bills or Splitsville? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Join Victoria, Jess and Bec as they put more yay in your Friday and celebrate your money wins of the week and answer a money dilemma about the best way to pay yourself as a small business owner. PLUS this week, you slid into our DMs about 'that' friend who NEVER pays their way in a bill split situation. We've all experienced it, but how do you deal with with?

item.title: Scarcity Mindset & Investing | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Have you ever found yourself worried that if someone gets pay rise, a promotion, or even some happiness in life it means you'll miss out? If so, you may have a scarcity mindset. Join Victoria and Bec as they look at the difference between scarcity and abundance mindsets, what you can do to shift from a negative to a positive outlook, how this effects your attitude towards investing and so much more!

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: 6 Figures at 19, Without a Uni Degree! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This Money Diarist wants you to know that you don't need a uni degree to earn 6 figures! Money was always tricky in her family but her mum has been a model of hard work and the main bread winner, working as a nurse. At 19, she's now in her dream job and has purchased an apartment. We can't for you to meet her! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: Baby Daddy Budget Betrayal! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Friday is the day we celebrate you, our gorgeous SOTM community! Join Victoria, Jess and Bec as they share your money wins and losses, and answer a money dilemma about how to manage different income streams. PLUS this week, someone slid into our D.Ms with quite a difficult situation. She's discovered her partner and soon to be baby daddy is secretly spending money on Only Fans...against her wishes AND their budget!

item.title: What Is A Lot Of Money? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description What does a lot of money look like to you? Is it a lifetime of financial freedom, or not checking your bank account every time you go to buy something? Well, everyone has a different answer, and it is absolutely a reflection of your money story! Join Victoria and Bec as they demystify some unconscious, or unhelpful ideas about how much you need to start investing, and also about how much money you need to be good with money.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: One Step at a Time After Losing the Love of Her Life | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This Money Diarist has been through it all. She had just resigned from her job as a personal injury lawyer in order to spend more time with her partner and pivot her life. That weekend, he died in an accident. On top of her world imploding, her financial stress went through the roof. It took 8 months for her income protection to set in and it didn’t include cover for psychological injury.

item.title: Always the Bridesmaid (paying), Never the Bride | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Friday is here again! Bring more yay to your day and join Victoria, Jess and Bec as they celebrate your money wins, answer a Money Dilemma about how to financially prepare for a divorce. AND, you slid into our DMs this week to ask about what financial expectation should be put on bridesmaids for a wedding. Well, you'd better believe the gals have thoughts on this one! If you're in financial trouble the National Debt Helpline are a great resource!

item.title: The Lipstick Index | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Have you ever treated yourself to a little extra something when you’re under financial stress? Nothing too big… but perhaps a new shade of nail polish, or eyeshadow, or lipstick? Well this such a common thing for us to do that it has a name, the Lipstick Index!
