And rolling into 2023, staring down the barrel of a recession, join Victoria Devine and our brand new cohost Bec Syed as they talk about why you're likely to hear this term a whole lot more this year!

item.title: Money Diaries: Life Is A Rollercoaster | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today's Money Diarist left a bad relationship and used to live week to week with her finances. Due to some ongoing mental health struggles, she was recently a patient at a psychiatric hospital. But at the end of last year she was married and is now in a really good place. We can't wait for you to meet this gorgeous and inspirational community member! This episode contains discussions of mental health struggles and eating disorders, if these are difficult topics for you, please check out one of our other episodes.

item.title: Bonus Episode: She's on The Money Book - 1st Chapter | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description With so many of us in the "new year new me" vibe, Victoria has decided to slide into your Saturday with a little bonus gift to get you inspired for 2023! This is the first chapter of the audiobook version of her first book She's On The Money, to get you motivated for 2023, enjoy! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: Introducing...Bec Syed! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Welcome to a fresh new Friday episode and meet our brand new cohost Bec Syed! You'll be hearing Bec on the show each Wednesday and Friday and we can't wait for you to get to know her - welcome to the team Bec! You might also notice that our Friday episodes are a little different this year? Join the gals as they revel in your Money Wins, solve a Money Dilemma about how to evaluate the best super company for you, PLUS with so many of you sliding into our DMs each week with questions or spicy thoughts, we thought we'd share these each week on a Friday.

item.title: Setting Intentions For The New Year | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description The new year is abundant with both the pressure and opportunity to turn over a new leaf! So on today's show Victoria and Jess discuss setting positive intentions for the year that lies ahead. What are some solid ways to get in touch with, and also set your goals? Join us on today's episode to find out! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Bridging Worlds | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This Money Diarist is a second generation immigrant who finds herself struggling to consolidate the experiences of her parents who didn't get the opportunity to finish high school, with her trajectory and aspirations. She is hardworking and ambitious, but still feels guilty for wanting more than what she grew up with. We can't wait for you to meet her! This year our Money Diaries are being brought to you by the legends at Shopback!

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: High Cost Of Living! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Join Victoria and Jess as they wrap the first week of the 2023, celebrating your money wins and discussing a Money Dilemma all about the best way to label your expenses. You can send us your Money Dilemma here. Plus they chat about something weighing heavily on all of us right now- cost of living stresses! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: Setting Up Your New Year Investment Plan | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description New year, new intentions! It’s the perfect time to make some investing resolutions, complete a good financial revue of the year that was and set some intentions for the year ahead. So join us today as Victoria steps us though how to get on the front foot with your financials for 2023! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Mopping Up After Identity Theft | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today's Money Diarist was only aware her identity had been stolen after the police emailed her father! She was arrested and even finger printed before her name was cleared, but it took a long time to mop up her credit history! She's a PHD student looking at maternal and child health in Papua New Guinea and sure has a story to tell. This year our Money Diaries are being brought to you by the legends at Shopback!

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: Babies, Bank Loans & Bloopers! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It is the final Friday of 2022, join Victoria, Jess plus their producer Annaliese to wrap the week that was, celebrate your money wins, commiserate the losses, and answer a poignant Money Dilemma about loving your job, but not the pay! The team also talk about discrimination against women on parental leave when it comes to bank loans. AND Annaliese has a special surprise for the gals which is NOT to be missed.

item.title: What's Your Investing Personality? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description New year, new you...right? This time of year is perfect for self reflection and goal setting, PLUS who doesn't love a personality quiz? So, on today's show we take a look at the different kinds of investing personalities. Listen in to find out which one you are, and set your "investment self" on the right path for 2023! What's Your Money Personality? Find out here. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: The Ones That Shook Us in 2022! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We adore Mondays thanks to opportunity to share the amazing stories of our community members on Money Diaries each week. The stories, the strength and the insight we get from you is just incredible! The best part is what we learn about each other through these episodes, SO our producer Annaliese asked Victoria to share some of the dairies that shook her in 2022! Listen back and bask in these wonderful stories.

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: Glen James, Christmas & Crypto! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy festive Friday! 'Tis the season to spend with friends, so we bring in our buddy Glen James and he picks his favorite money wins from our Facebook group! Plus we wrap the week that was, and answer a Money Dilemma about how best to help your partner with their financial literacy. And with the fiasco that was the recent FTX Crypto bankruptcy, Victoria, Jess and Glen have MANY thoughts to share.

item.title: Your Top Christmas Savings Hacks! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We love Christmas, and we love our community. It also gets us incredibly excited to hear your money wins and tips, so we thought...why not combine all of our favourite things in this episode in the week of Christmas? Today we are celebrating our top 10 SOTM Community Christmas savings hacks, listen in and take notes! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: A Vet With a Vision! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description She's a super driven and hardworking veterinarian who, due to her often 100+ per week work load, often treats herself a little too much. Who can blame her right? But this means she finds herself barely scraping by despite her 6 figure salary. She joins Victoria to talk bad habits, big ideas and so much more! This year our Money Diaries are being brought to you by the legends at Shopback!

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: So Over Unpaid Overtime! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday! We celebrate the end of the week with a wrap of the week, share your money wins and losses and answer a Money Dilemma all about where to store large amounts of money. PLUS the gals talk all about the social and financial cost of unpaid overtime. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: Navigating the Social & Financial Anxiety of Christmas | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description You know how much Victoria and Jess love Christmas, but it is also an unbelievably stressful time for so many! In between breaking your budget, over extending yourself on the social front, and tricky family situations it can be a time that fills us with anxiety instead of joy. So on today's episode we talk practical tips for taking the pressure off in the silly season! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Struggling with Toxic Perfectionism | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today's Money Diarist knew something was really wrong when she found herself crying on the floor after she landed her dream job. She uncovered a toxic perfectionist pattern in her life and after a good old soul search, returned to uni to study international development and climate change. She then went into 20k of debt to look after her aging doggo, lost her father to cancer, and through therapy was diagnosed with OCD.

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: (Pay) Secrets Be Gone! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday! Join Victoria and Jess as they share your money wins and losses, recap the week that was and answer a Money Dilemma about the complexity of prenups. You can submit your Money Dilemma here. Also the girls are THRILLED about the new industrial relations reforms banning pay secrecy, supporting more flexibility for employees and targeting discrimination and they talk all about it! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: The Top 5 Performing ASX ETFs of the Financial Year! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Addendum: During 2022 Mirae Asset Global Investments and Global X ETFs acquired ETF Securities Australia, so the ETFS S&P 500 High Yield Low Volatility (ZYUS) is now the Global X S&P 500 High Yield Low Volatility ETF (ZYUS) With so many of you on your investment journey, and the end of the year at our doorstep, today on the show we wrap the 5 best performing ASX ETFs of the last financial year!

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: She's a Nurse In a Jail With Big Goals! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description When today's Money Diarist was 17, she packed her bags and headed interstate with one suitcase. Now at 25, she's a registered nurse in a jail and is working hard towards her 3 year goal of buying her first home with her partner. Don't miss this interesting story! This year our Money Diaries are being brought to you by the legends at Shopback! Check them out at https://app.shopback.com/aus/partner/SOTM and you'll get a cashback bonus when you sign up!

item.title: She's On The Money Radio Recap: 3 December | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Welcome to the final She's On the Money Radio Show of the year! Join Victoria and Mitch as they talk retro toys and homewares that fetch a fortune, cheap ways to entertain the kids on the holidays, and some coin saving tips for Super Saver Saturday! Plus this week's Money Dilemma is about pre-nups. Submit your Money Dilemma here. All this and more on today's show. You can catch us live on the KIIS network, or listen to your heart's content via the iHeartRadio app every Saturday from 9am - 10am.

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: Wedding & Inflation Interplay | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's Friday so celebrate with Victoria and Jess as they recap the SOTM week and share your money wins and losses! This week's Money Dilemma is all about whether to prioritise home ownership over having more savings in the bank. Submit your Money Dilemma here. Plus...weddings. Yep, with V fresh off the back of hers we talk about the big day and the dollars behind it! Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements.

item.title: What is Points Hacking? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Points hacking is not about having anything stolen, it's all about maximising the benefits of your points to get free things like flights, upgrades, hotels and household goods. So on today's show we introduce you to how some of these systems operate and where you can get more information! And as we ALWAYS say on SOTM, credit cards are NOT for everyone so it is important to do your due diligence and see if these systems work for you.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Working Remote & Kicking Goals | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This inspirational member of our community learned the value of money from her Grandmother who budgeted every dollar of her Centrelink pension. The father of her child left when she was 23 years old and seven and a half months pregnant, so after he was born she moved to an Aboriginal community for work. With her living expenses heavily subsidised she was able to purchase her own home at 26 years old all by herself!

item.title: She's On The Money Radio Recap: 26 November | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Celebrate Saturday with She's On The Money Radio Show as Victoria gives you more tips to save with Super Saver Saturday, and solves your Money Dilemmas (send your Money Dilemma here). Plus the team talk the new regulations in the buy now, play later space. We also play a game of Facebook Marketplace Trash or Treasure, and Victoria give the scoop on some hot dupes! All this and more on today's show.

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: Black Fri-yay or Nay? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Welcome to Friday! And not just any Friday, but one where many will find themselves in a shopping frenzy. That's right, it's Black Friday and the gals chat the yays, and nays of the day. Plus we recap the week, celebrate your money wins and commiserate the losses, and answer a juicy Money Dilemma all about protecting your data in a leak (which coincidentally was our Deep Dive this week too!

item.title: How To Protect Your Financial Data | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Another day, another data breach! So today's show is EXTRA important as we give you some practical actions to ensure you’re doing what you can to protect your precious data online. We’ll also talk about how to identify scams, and what to do if you think your data or identity has been stolen. Acknowledgement of Country By Natarsha Bamblett aka Queen Acknowledgements. The advice shared on She's On The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Making Change from Classroom to Boardroom! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This gorgeous member of our community has a VERY full plate! She's a dedicated Humanities and Social Sciences teacher with a commitment to invoking a passion for social justice, especially equality for women. She's also a director on a board for a non-profit NDIS service provider, all the while managing a chronic health condition (endometriosis) with the ever increasing demands of her teaching role. And we haven't even mentioned her property journey yet.

item.title: She's On The Money Radio Recap: 19 November | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Start your Saturday with She's On The Money Radio Show! As usual. Victoria gives you more tips to save with Super Saver Saturday, and solves your Money Dilemmas (send your Money Dilemma here). And Black Friday is coming and the team talk ALL about it! Victoria shares her tips and their pick of the sales. All this and more on today's show! You can catch us live on the KIIS network, or listen to your heart's content via the iHeartRadio app every Saturday from 9am - 10am.

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: Farewell Georgia King! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description On this emotional episode of Friday Drinks we say farewell to our gal Georgia King! We'll miss you so much GK, thank you for a beautiful 3 years of your dulcet tones on SOTM, we're so genuinely excited for your next chapter!! Plus, we recap the week, share your money wins and solve a Money Dilemma about the slippery slope into debt and how to dig yourself out of it!

item.title: Tenant's Rights | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know that currently 31% of households in Australia are rented, and rent at the moment is 9.1% higher across capital cities and 10.8% in regional areas? With so many of us feeling the pinch, how many of us actually know our rights when it comes to renting? On the show today we’ll be providing an overview of the current rental situation, outline exactly what you can and can’t do as a tenant and we’ll explain what to do if you run into trouble with your landlord.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: From IVF Debt to Getting Ahead! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week's Money Diarist and her husband spent 100K on IVF, and despite that managed to purchase a house and trim down their debt. Now they have 3 beautiful kids AND an emergency fund. We can't wait for you to meet this gorgeous member of our community! This year our Money Diaries are being brought to you by the legends at Shopback! Check them out at https://app.shopback.com/aus/partner/SOTM and you'll get a cashback bonus when you sign up!

item.title: She's On The Money Radio Recap: 12 November | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Ring in your Saturday with She's On The Money Radio Show. Victoria gives you more tips to save with Super Saver Saturday, and solves your Money Dilemmas (send your Money Dilemma here). Plus, we ask if we're headed towards a recession AND we're joined by some special guests from Channel 9's The Block! All this and more on today's show! You can catch us live on the KIIS network, or listen to your heart's content via the iHeartRadio app every Saturday from 9am - 10am.

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: Discussing the Dollars Behind TikTok! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday! This week we talk financial red flags in relationships, recap our amazing Money Diarist, celebrate your money wins AND solve a Money Dilemma about paying down a current mortgage for a home, versus purchasing additional investment properties. Send through your Money Dilemma here. And in finance news the gals talk Khaby Lame the TikTok creator who makes up to 1.1 million dollars per post!! They dive into the numbers and the mind ABSOLUTELY boggles!

item.title: Financial Red Flags In Relationships | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Do you have difficulty talking to your partner about money? Do they often borrow money and not pay it back? Has a new partner ever pressured you into opening a joint account? On this episode we talk financial red flags in relationships, what these might look like, how to have healthy boundaries and conversations around money and so much more! If this topic raises some concerns for you, here are some places can get support:

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Carrying the Pressure & Bridging Two Worlds | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This Money Diarist is a 22 year old, first generation immigrant from Sri-Lanka and on top of studying her masters in psychology is managing full time work and three casual jobs! With her home country of Sri Lanka enduring the worst economic crisis it has ever seen, and her father still living there, she struggles with her desire for the 22-year-old care-free life of her peers and the very real need to provide for her parents.

item.title: She's On The Money Radio Recap - 5 November | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Put more savings in your Saturday with She's On the Money Radio Show. Incase you've been living under a rock, Victoria is getting married this weekend, so the gang talk all things wedding costs! Plus speaking of expensive there has been yet ANOTHER interest rate rise, and the team have feelings. All this and more on today's show! You can catch us live on the KIIS network, or listen to your heart's content via the iHeartRadio app every Saturday from 9am - 10am.

item.title: What Is Passive Investing? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today we are chatting all about passive investing, an extremely popular investing method due to its laid back approach and gradual returns over the long-term. But what do we need to be mindful of and how exactly does it compare to its exact opposite method of active investing? Join Georgia King and Victoria Devine to learn more about this approach, the pros and cons and how to decide what might suit your needs best.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: She's Self Taught, Self Starting and Smashing It! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday! This member of our community decided from a very young age that she didn't ever want to have to rely on a partner for her financial stability, and has been working hard to flip her family script ever since. She now owns two properties and rents one to her Grandparents who have experienced financial hardship. Her second property was bought with he equity from her first, she's started her investment journey, AND she is 100% smashing her financial literacy goals too.

item.title: BONUS EPISODE: The Psychology Of Saving | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We thought we'd spice up your Sunday with a very special BONUS episode all about the psychology of saving with Victoria Devine and special guest Dr Lili Sussman. Lili is a Social Scientist and the Chief Strategy Officer at Wisr. Her PhD research at Harvard University was on decision-making, behavioral economics, and psychology in foreign policy decision-making. Don't miss this fascinating discussion about the last great taboo of financial stress, the disconnect between intention and action, the importance of self love, how to make meaningful change and SO much more!

Plus this week, they unpack the implications of the announced merger of ANZ and Suncorp Banks. And, Jess has a BIG surprise for Victoria. What is it? You'll need to tune in to find out! Here are some links we mention in today's show:

item.title: Travel Savings Hacks | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description After long last travel is back on! But with the exchange rate poor and fuel prices high, travel may be out of reach for most of us. So we want to give you some travel saving hacks on today’s episode. From the cheapest time to book flights, to rentable routers and more…you name it, the girls have the downlow! ICYMI, listen back to our full episode on Travel Insurance from last week too!

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: From Public Housing to 10k a Week as a Sex Worker | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week's Money Diarist has a loving and supportive husband, kids and is making bank earning between 5-10k per week as a sex worker. The pandemic meant she had to pivot her in person business to online, which absolutely flourished. In this fascinating episode, she shares her story of growing up in public housing, being a single mother, and some of the tricky sides of the business she loves so much.

item.title: She's On The Money Radio Recap - 16th July | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Join Victoria Devine and Mitch Churi to roll into your weekend right on She's On The Money Radio! Plus, if you’re struggling with your cash flow and got yourself in a bit of a situation, hit us up at She’s On The Money Socials with your Money Dilemma!

item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday! item.description: Podcast Description With travel finally back on the cards, today we unpack travel insurance! Why do you need it, what level of cover should you consider, and what are some important things to remember when driving a car overseas or trying to safeguard yourself against Covid catastrophes? The advice shared on She’s on The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.description: Podcast Description She's a new Australian citizen with multiple small businesses on the go, is a driver partner for Uber, PLUS she has a baby on the way! With lofty ambitions, this delicate balance has her well on her way to achieving her financial dreams. Who is she? This year our Money Diaries are being brought to you by the legends at Shopback! item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: Live 3rd Birthday Extravaganza! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description To celebrate She's On the Money's 3rd birthday, we threw a party! So join us for this very special episode as we LITERALLY kick back with the girls...and you, bev in hand and celebrate your money wins, catch up on what's been happening in the community, and solve a bunch of Money Dilemmas asked live in person from our gorgeous community! Thank you so much to everyone who came along to celebrate with us, it was such a special night and so wonderful to meet you all!

item.title: What is a Bear Market? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description With the ASX having lost approx. 10% of it's value over the past financial year and investor confidence down, we are officially in a bear market! On this episode, we dive head long into the causes and effects of this current state of affairs and what may lie ahead. We look at what a bear market is, what it means for us, and why we are in one.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: Staying Financially Afloat & Living On A Boat! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description It's time for our favorite part of the week again, where we get to meet a community member! This week; she learned the value of money early on when both of her parents retired young. Now, she is gearing up for a life afloat, and is moving onto a boat with her partner to save money. She's hard working, dedicated and definitely thinks outside of the box, we can't wait for you to meet her!

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: "Stable" Coins, Crypto Horses and more! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday...the gang is back together and boy do they have a convo for you! item.description: Podcast Description With her grandmother's words still ringing in her ears this Money Diarist is learning to shift from a scarcity to abundance mindset. She came to Australia at 16 and became a single parent at 19. By choice she continued on her journey as a single mother, now with 3 kids. Not only is she kicking goals but changing her mindset along the way! Who is she? Find out on this episode of Money Diaries.

item.title: Understanding Income Guilt | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description On this episode we unpack income guilt. Closely related to spending guilt, it's a relatively new term, but not a new experience. And while it can be a reaction to socio economic inequality, it is very often a result of your money story and background. Join Georgia and Jess as they look at the causes, constraints and commonalties of income guilt. The advice shared on She’s on The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: A Single Mum On Welfare With A Foot In Each World | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today's community member is a single mum who lives on welfare and gets by with a stack of tiny side hustles. She shares her story of battling for custody and keeping her head above water, while trying to prioritise quality care and time with her daughter. Warning: this episode contains discussion of domestic violence If you or anyone you know needs support: Phone: 1800RESPECT Or head to: https://www.respect.gov.au/services/

item.title: She's On The Money Radio Recap - 28th May | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy SOTM Saturday! This week on the She's On The Money Radio Show hear which guilty pleasures Victoria Devine and Mitch Churi cannot live without. The advice shared on She’s on The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

item.title: Property Pressure: Buy Now Or Wait? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description When considering purchasing property it is so easy to get caught up in media hype and fall into other people's ideas of what we should aspire to. In this episode we discuss the current state of the property market, check our values and how they align with external pressures in society. We'll give you some things to consider when deciding whether to purchase property. Do you do it now or wait to save a deposit?

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: The Life and Finances of an Undercover Cop | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description After working as a covert operative (undercover) Police officer, this Money Diarist felt burnt out and took 7 months leave without pay. So she started her own business AND bought a van to travel round Australia. Having since retuned to work, and selling her business for a profit, she has her sights set on new things. Listen in to hear her amazing journey. This year our Money Diaries are being brought to you by the legends at Shopback!

item.title: She's On The Money Radio Recap - 21st May | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Welcome to the first ever episode of the She's On The Money Radio Show! Victoria Devine and Mitch Churi refuse to be upstaged by a democracy sausage/Federal Election day and bring you an hour of radio power with some Super Saving tips to keep more bucks in your bank. And if you’re struggling with your cash flow and need some advice, hit us up on the She’s On The Money Socials for Money Matters.

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: Picking Apart Party Promises | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Amidst the slings and arrows of a Federal Election countdown it is easy to zoom in on particular political promises. On this Friday Drinks, the girls zoom out on the pomp and promises, and Victoria does the math on a certain headline policy around withdrawing Super to purchase a first home. PLUS, as ever we recap the week, celebrate your money wins and answer a Money Dilemma about salary sacrificing!

item.title: Budgeting For A Wedding | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Here at She's On The Money, we LOVE a wedding but you'd be hard pressed to find another major life event that combines all of our aspirations, dreams, family and social pressures, traditions and expectations into one VERY costly package! They can quickly turn into anxiety riddled harbingers of debt, instead of a beautiful transition into the next phase of life. So on this episode we unpack the context, complications and costs of the big day.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: An Executive with Social Justice In Her Heart | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This Money Diarist will get you motivated to step up for a seat at the table. As the first in her family to get a degree, she became an Executive for a not for profit as a single mother with a 6 year old daughter. By the time she left her "dream job" it had a staff of over 200 people and she oversaw a budget of close to 30mil.

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: RBA Rates & A Wild Goose Chase! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description You know what Friday means? That's right, it's time we kick back and roll through this week's episodes, celebrate your money wins, solve a Money Dilemma (which you can submit here by the way), and talk about what's been in the news. But this week, guess which member of the team took matters into her own hands and went on a WILD goose chase to remedy the situation? You'll have to listen to find out!

item.title: Having Difficult Conversations With Your Boss | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description One of the most common questions we get from our community is how to have that tricky conversation with your boss. So on this episode we talk about common workplace complaints, how to research and negotiate a pay rise and how to be more assertive. We also touch on discrimination laws in Australia and the fair work commission, with some resources you can lean on if you have experienced discrimination, harassment or unsafe conditions.

item.title: MONEY DIARIES: A Phoenix Rising From The Ashes | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This Money Diarist left us utterly speechless! Having survived an abusive relationship, she was lumped with $120,000 in debt on credit cards she didn't even know existed. It took 7 years and ended up costing her $250,000, but she is finally debt free. And you'd better believe she is living her best life; in her dream job, as a home owner, with a wonderful partner AND with a successful side hustle.

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: Interest Rates, Inflation &....Horses? Oh my! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Hey hey it's Friday! By the way, you can reach out to us with your Money Dilemmas here! AND in the midst of this RBA rate hike, election countdown kerfuffle of a week, the ladies kick back for a chat about HELP debt, the CPI index, inflation and so much more!

item.title: What Is The Difference Between Investment Platforms? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description With so many people in ours and the broader community starting their investment journeys, now has never been a better time to brush up our investment literacy. What is Robo Advice? Listen in to find out! The advice shared on She’s on The Money is general in nature and does not consider your individual circumstances.

It's an important conversation to have, but if it's not one you're feeling like having today that's okay, know that we love you endlessly and are proud that you're putting your mental health first.

item.title: In Conversation: Kait Fenwick | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Friday angels! We hope you've been enjoying our International Women's Day content this week, but sadly it's coming to an end with this very last, very special interview with Kait Fenwick. Kait is a transgender diversity and inclusion specialist, SOTM community member and public health student living in Muloobinba on unceded Awabakal Country. They're wildly passionate about equity in the context of health, dismantling exclusive organisational culture and centring the lived experience of historically underrepresented peoples within workplaces - what a special human!

item.title: In Conversation: Jessica Quinn | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Wednesday angels, we hope you enjoyed our Monday In Conversation, and we're back with another one in honour of International Women's Day (or week, as we've decided!) Let us introduce you to the effervescent Jess Quinn who, in her own words, is quite literally a walking miracle. Her body has been completely restructured so that she could survive an aggressive cancer. Jess's leg was amputated just before her ninth birthday, and she has had to adapt to living with a prosthetic leg.

item.title: In Conversation: Aunty Munya Andrews and Carla Rogers from Evolve Communities | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY INTERNATIONAL WOMEN'S WEEK ANGELS! We know, we know - that's not a real thing. But we've decided it is this week because International Women's Day is just not enough for us. This week we're switching out our regular content with not one, but THREE epic chats, with THREE epic people we know you're going to learn a lot from. These people are absolute powerhouses and have voices that need to be heard.

item.title: FRIDAY DRINKS: is it okay to ask questions about my share portfolio right now? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description The world is a tricky place for most of us to navigate at the best of times, but right now it's extra challenging for many of our community, but does that mean we shouldn't be asking insensitive questions like "what's happening to my share portfolio?" when others are going through far more traumatic things? Join J, V and G to discuss the ins and outs of caring for the world, while still ensuring you're safe in it.

item.title: Should you pay for your partners kid? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week G + V breakdown the intricate and not so simple situation of managing a relationship with a partner who has a child/children. Should you be financially supporting them? Is that your responsibility, or is it theirs? Is it perhaps a joint responsibility? What if you haven't moved in together yet, what happens then? Join us for a pretty pervy convo on how to have the discussion, but also to learn about some things you should be taking into consideration.

You may have noticed we paused our content on Friday - there was no pod, no presence on socials and no newsletter - as it didn't feel right to be getting up to our usual antics in the wake of such disaster.

So we need to start talking now about what this means and how it works, because whether you've inherited $500, or $5 million - showing that money the respect it deserves is really important. So join us, as we discuss a number of hypotheticals, and also talk about a number of real-life inheritance stories.

item.title: Financial Perfectionism | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Perfectionism is often something we celebrate in Aussie culture, however when it comes to finance, we think too much perfectionism spoils the soup. Transcript

item.title: Loyalty Tax is costing you thousands each year | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Are you paying more for being loyal? Probably. Today we discuss the hard to spot ‘loyalty tax’ costing Aussies thousands of dollars each year. Transcript

item.title: She's on the (my millennial) money Q&A | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Are you ready? The mum and dad of finance have come together to answer all your burning finance questions. This week Glen James from my millennial money kicks Georgia out of her hot seat and our producer (and KIIS FM Summer Breakfast Radio Host) Ryan Jon stepped in to facilitate the chat. Buckle down friends, this one was a goodie. Transcript

item.title: Buy now, regulate never? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description What’s the go with regulating Buy Now Pay Later and should these providers be obliged to operate with a little more integrity? We think so. But what does this mean and what would it look like in reality? Transcript

item.title: Millennials are entitled (to take their paid leave) | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description As it turns out there is lots you’re entitled to as an employee in Aus including a few things you may never have heard of, so if you’re not too sure about what your work rights are, then drop everything (within reason) and get this ep in your ears ASAP. Transcript

item.title: 5 ways to not go broke this festive season | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Christmas is coming (we’re not sure how either) and to help you navigate your way through this offensively pricey time without sabotaging the savings, we’ve slapped together our top tips for budgeting ahead of this silly season. Transcript

item.title: How to navigate sales like a pro | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Are sales just a marketing ploy to get you to buy more, or can they be utilised to help you save a few extra bucks? The answer is BOTH, which we explain in depth in today’s episode, so you can navigate the looming pre-Xmas sales expertly. Plus we chat awards, Dyson vacuums and trees falling silently (or is it loudly?) in forests. You don’t want to miss it.

item.title: Bonus Ep: Budget beauty hacks with Beauty IQ Uncensored | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Dynamic duo Hannah and Jo from Adore Beauty’s Beauty IQ Uncensored podcast join us today to chat beauty on a budget, answering everything from which products we can save on and which are worth investing in, as well as the scoop when it comes to The Ordinary, SPF, serums and more. Transcript

item.title: Health Insurance 101 | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Health insurance: is it all hype or do we really need it? Today, we decipher it all including the tax implications and some other tricky things to be mindful of. Transcript

item.title: How to invest part two: Now we know micro investing is legit | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today we answer the burning micro-investing questions we know you’re dying to hear. Is it better to start with a large deposit and add to it from there? Transcript

item.title: How to invest part one: Is micro investing legit? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Micro-investing platforms: what are they and are they right for you? Perceived by many as the entry-level step to investing, Transcript

item.title: This girl is on FIRE... | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description The FIRE movement - Financial Independence Retire Early - is making waves in Aus, but is this path to retiring in our thirties actually as sweet as it sounds? PLUS, we’re back to the regular format this week with a brilliant money diarist and a listener question from someone seeking help on where the heck to start with investing. Transcript

item.title: Lettuce taco bout (food) budgeting | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Today we talk through tips on how you can save a buck (or several) on your food and groceries, which is probably the tastiest topic we’ve ever tackled (ha!). Transcript

item.title: Pink Tax: The cost of being a woman | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description What is the “pink tax” and how is it holding Australian’s back? Today we reveal all. PLUS, we chat the disgrace that is the 14% gender pay gap that still exists in Australia, and we sit down with Dr Hannah from the amazing reproductive health podcast: Uteryou, Uterme, Uterus, who helps us answer your questions on the real cost of women’s health. Transcript

item.title: What is a recession? What does it mean for us? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Australia is officially in a recession, so what does that actually mean for you? Today, we unpack it all and we also break down exactly what we need to do to safeguard our finances during this fraught time. Transcript

item.title: The six clever money hacks to help you save faster! | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Ever wondered what Victoria’s top saving hacks are? Wonder no more! Today acclaimed financial advisor Victoria Devine breaks down her top money savings tricks, with a few stray recommendations thrown in by George. The girls also talk about the psychology behind why some people are amazing savers and others are not, PLUS they discuss oat milk, gyms, glass doors and a whole lot more! So hop to it friend!

item.title: Let's talk about money and your mental health | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week we tackled a big one: mental health and money. We all know money is frequently listed at the top of the typical Aussie’s list of biggest stressors, so why exactly is this the case and what tools can we use to combat it? Transcript

item.title: What happens to your money when you die? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description At SOTM we spend lots of time talking about how we can attain financial freedom, but what exactly happens to our money when we’re not here anymore? Today we unpack it all, including why having a will is the way (ha!) and what exactly the consequences of not having one can be. Transcript

item.title: Budget like a BOSS | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description If the word budgeting makes you feel blergh then this sweet friend is the episode for you. Today on the show we discuss why managing our budget and cash flow is essential to attaining financial freedom and we also talk through the practicalities of how we can utilise these systems to help us get out or avoid getting into unwanted debt. Transcript

item.title: Bonus Ep: Finished Differently | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This special bonus episode of She’s on the Money is brought to you by our friends at Jacobs Creek who gave us the opportunity to share some inspiring stories from our community from some of you who have finished your journey’s differently. Transcript

item.title: Is FOMO stealing your savings? | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description This week we untangled the knotty topic that is FOMO, discussing exactly why ‘fear of missing out’ is wreaking havoc on our bank accounts and sabotaging our savings. Transcript

item.title: Sparking joy: It's time to Marie Kondo your finances | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description Is it a good idea to borrow QUEEN Kondo’s principals of tidying up and apply them to our finances? Victoria says YES. Join us as we chat all things money minimalism, from exactly what it is, to how we can start making some practical, easy to follow changes today. It’s a blimmin’ good chat – we pinky promise. Transcript

item.title: "We want prenup! We want prenup!" (Yeah!) | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description We know divorce can be extremely painful emotionally, but what about financially? This week, we talk through the real cost of divorce, explaining how to set ourselves up financially if we are staring down the barrel of a big break up, as well as ways we can keep the cost as low as possible. Transcript

item.title: Sounds like MLM but okay | She's On The Money
item.description: Podcast Description MLMs – they’re the multilevel marketing business models that promise an amazing lifestyle and a generous pay packet, but in reality, the overwhelming majority of those entangled in MLMs lose money, escaping the experience emotionally and financially drained. Transcript
